primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from human self-deception (building monuments to the self) to the reception of God's unconditional love through the 'smallness' of Christ.

subject.identificatie: God (as the source of unconditional love/grace) and Christ (as the one who becomes small).
tekstueel_bewijs: God actually swooped in and made you king by grace.
He [Jesus] doesn’t take life; he gives his life.
He [Jesus] did all of that for you.

object.identificatie: A 'liberated' self-image and the ability to be 'clear-eyed' about one's flaws.
tekstueel_bewijs: There is nothing more liberating than to be so loved you can finally admit that you’re flawed.
It was because the Lord loved you that he set his love upon you.
Now come as the sinner you are to God who loves you.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is invited to identify as the Receiver of grace rather than the Subject of performance.

tekstueel_bewijs: Exhort one another daily, lest you be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the primary Subject; Christ is the Mediator/Helper who 'becomes small'.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implied as the power that allows one to 'live into' the new self-image.

tegenstander.identificatie: Self-deception / Arrogance / The need to be 'big' in one's own eyes.
tekstueel_bewijs: The almost infinite capacity of the human heart for self-deception.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Self-deception is presented as an 'idolatry' that blinds the heart to God and leads to destruction (Saul's rejection).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical life of the believer: being honest about flaws and living in community.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer.
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ability to be honest (Secondary) is strictly a consequence of being unconditionally loved by God (Primary).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God actually swooped in and made you king.
He wants to see you as you are.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You have to live into it.

voorbeelden: We know how we should live.
I desperately didn’t want there to be anything wrong.
The real problem... is not that we don’t know how we should live.
We aren’t able to do it.
The only love... that gives you the basis... is the unconditional love of God.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the human 'lack of power' (inability to be good/honest) and provides the 'power' through the external gift of God's love.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Saul's rejection) to ~S1 (Self-deception) to ~S2 (Honesty) and finally to S1 (Grace in Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes the 'smallness' and 'rejection' of S2 to provide the S1 security that enables ~S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; Saul's rejection is presented as final and sobering.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon contains many 'shoulds' regarding honesty, they are explicitly grounded in the prior, unconditional action of God in Christ. The 'engine' is theocentric.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Why do we do the terrible things we do?

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ lost everything... He did all of that for you.
I love you just because I love you... It’s unconditional.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Saul is used as a negative example (anti-model) of the human condition, but the solution is not 'be better than Saul' but 'receive the grace Saul rejected'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God is the one who makes the small big.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and liberation from the 'mask' of performance.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification by grace alone is the psychological foundation for ethics.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the problem (self-deception) to the solution (Christ's smallness) is logically and narratively tight.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'sobering' rejection of Saul and the 'unconditional' love of God.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ... became small... so that we... could know we are great in the eyes of God.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the 'power' to the Gospel message and the community rather than explicitly to the Holy Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is described as a 'deceitfulness' that hardens the heart and ruins lives.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God/Christ as the Subject of the rescue mission, with the hearer as the beneficiary of a new identity.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might identify too much with the 'effort' of being honest.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: The 'small' child who is simply loved.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that even the 'honesty' is a gift, not a new work.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong focus on Savoir (knowing) and Pouvoir (being able).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase focus on the Spirit's role in 'Vouloir' (the desire to be honest).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly mention the Holy Spirit as the one who applies Christ's work to the heart.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (self-deception) is already very well-developed.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of moving from a 'Law' text to a 'Gospel' resolution without bypassing the gravity of the human condition.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the use of the 'car' and 'pilot' illustrations, semiotics reveals these are all manifestations of the same 'Opponent' (Self-Deception).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical context of the Amalekites; semiotics focuses on the functional role of 'Divine Justice' versus 'Imperialism'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model exposes that the 'monument' Saul builds is a rival 'Object' of value that necessitates the exclusion of God as 'Sender'.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'Subject-switch' from the failing human (Saul) to the succeeding God (Christ) as the pivot point.
